meanings.definition: A unit of time used in sedimentation analysis.
meanings.sent1: The experiment took one svedberg to complete.
meanings.sent2: The svedberg measurement was crucial for the research.
meanings.sent3: I tried to measure time in svedbergs, but it just made things confusing.
meanings.sent4: In the world of science, a svedberg can feel like a blink of an eye.
meanings.sent5: The svedberg unit made the concept of time in experiments more precise.

meanings.sent1: The svedberg showed how fast the particles settled.
meanings.sent2: Scientists compared the svedberg of various samples.
meanings.sent3: Watching sedimentation rates is oddly satisfying, like observing a svedberg race.
meanings.sent4: The svedberg rate was so slow, it felt like time stood still.
meanings.sent5: The svedberg measurement highlighted the differences in settling speeds.

meanings.definition: A unit of measurement for sedimentation coefficients.
meanings.sent1: The svedberg helped determine the sedimentation coefficient accurately.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician recorded the svedberg of the sample.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally mixed up the svedberg values, and chaos ensued.
meanings.sent4: The sedimentation coefficients were as clear as a svedberg on a sunny day.
meanings.sent5: Understanding sedimentation coefficients became easier with the svedberg unit.
